name: New York State Department of Motor Vehicles

documents.title: Driver License Renewal Guide
documents.summary: Complete guide to renewing your NY driver's license online, by mail, or in person.
documents.content:
To renew your New York State driver license, you have several options:

ONLINE RENEWAL (Recommended):
1. Visit dmv.ny.gov
2. Sign in to your MyDMV account
3. Select 'Renew License'
4. Verify your information
5. Pay the $64.50 renewal fee
6. Your new license will arrive by mail in 2 weeks

IN-PERSON RENEWAL:
1. Visit any DMV office
2. Bring your current license
3. Complete a vision test
4. Pay the renewal fee
5. Receive a temporary license immediately

BY MAIL:
1. Complete form MV-44
2. Include a check or money order for $64.50
3. Mail to: NYS DMV, 6 Empire State Plaza, Albany, NY 12228

ELIGIBILITY:
- You can renew up to 1 year before expiration
- You can renew up to 2 years after expiration without retesting
- Enhanced licenses require in-person renewal

REQUIRED DOCUMENTS:
- Current driver license
- Proof of NY residency (if address changed)
- Social Security number verification (if not on file)

documents.title: REAL ID Requirements
documents.summary: Information about REAL ID requirements and how to upgrade your license.
documents.content:
REAL ID OVERVIEW:
Starting May 7, 2025, you'll need a REAL ID or Enhanced license to board domestic flights and enter federal facilities.

HOW TO GET A REAL ID:
1. Visit a DMV office in person (required)
2. Bring proof of:
   - Identity (birth certificate, passport)
   - Social Security number
   - NY residency (2 documents)
   - Name change documents (if applicable)
3. Pay the standard license fee

REAL ID vs ENHANCED LICENSE:
- REAL ID: Domestic flights, federal facilities
- Enhanced: All REAL ID benefits PLUS Canada/Mexico border crossing
- Enhanced costs $30 more than standard license

STANDARD LICENSE STILL VALID FOR:
- Driving
- Voting
- State ID purposes
- TSA PreCheck (with valid passport)

documents.title: Vehicle Registration
documents.summary: How to register your vehicle in New York State.
documents.content:
VEHICLE REGISTRATION IN NEW YORK:

NEW VEHICLE REGISTRATION:
1. Visit a DMV office with:
   - Title or Manufacturer's Certificate of Origin
   - Proof of insurance (NY insurance card)
   - Proof of identity
   - Payment for fees
2. Complete form MV-82
3. Pay registration fee ($26-$140 based on weight)
4. Receive plates and registration

TRANSFER FROM ANOTHER STATE:
1. Within 30 days of becoming NY resident
2. Vehicle must pass NY inspection
3. Bring out-of-state title and registration
4. Proof of NY insurance required

RENEWAL:
- Online at dmv.ny.gov (most vehicles)
- By mail with renewal notice
- In person at DMV office
- Registration valid for 2 years

INSPECTION REQUIREMENTS:
- Annual safety inspection required
- Emissions test in designated areas
- Must be inspected before registration
